channel.title: Hawaii Home Rates
channel.description: Recent content on Hawaii Home Rates

item.title: Credit Score Impact on Hawaii Mortgage Rates
item.description:
Credit Score Impact on Hawaii Mortgage Rates

Credit score has a major impact on Hawaii mortgage pricing. Lenders price by credit tier, and even a 20–40 point improvement can reduce your rate and APR significantly. Because Hawaii has higher loan balances, the monthly savings can be substantial.

Hawaii Credit Tiers (Typical Pricing)

  • 760+: Best pricing (lowest rates and fees)
  • 740–759: ~0.125% higher
  • 720–739: ~0.25% higher
  • 700–719: ~0.50% higher
  • Below 680: Often requires FHA or specialty programs

Monthly Payment Impact Example

Loan amount: $600,000

item.title: APR vs Interest Rate in Hawaii: What Homebuyers Should Compare
item.description:
APR vs Interest Rate in Hawaii: What Homebuyers Should Compare

Hawaii mortgage pricing varies by lender and island. To compare lenders fairly, borrowers should focus on APR (annual percentage rate), not just the interest rate. APR captures total borrowing costs, including lender fees and points.

Interest Rate vs APR

  • Interest rate is the cost of borrowing, applied to your loan balance.
  • APR includes the interest rate plus lender fees, points, and closing costs.

APR gives you a better apples-to-apples comparison across Hawaii lenders, especially when fees vary by island.

item.title: Hawaii Jumbo Mortgage Rates: Honolulu, Maui, and Resort Market Pricing
item.description:
Hawaii Jumbo Mortgage Rates: Honolulu, Maui, and Resort Market Pricing

Hawaii has some of the highest home values in the country, making jumbo loans common across Oahu and resort markets. Jumbo pricing can vary significantly by lender, property type, and occupancy. Borrowers in Honolulu, Wailea, and Kapalua should plan to compare multiple jumbo lenders to capture the best pricing.

What Is a Jumbo Loan in Hawaii?

Hawaii’s high-cost conforming loan limit is $1,149,825 (2025-2026). Any loan above that limit is a jumbo mortgage. Jumbo lending is common for:

item.title: Hawaii Mortgage Rates by Island: Oahu vs Maui vs Kauai vs Big Island
item.description:
Hawaii Mortgage Rates by Island: Oahu vs Maui vs Kauai vs Big Island

Hawaii mortgage rates vary more by island than most borrowers expect. Lender competition, property types, and second-home demand all influence pricing. Oahu tends to have the lowest rates due to volume and competition, while Maui and Kauai often price higher because of second-home and resort exposure. The Big Island sits between the two with more conforming loan activity and larger properties.
